result.execSummary:
The defendant Equinees A Boyles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Equinees A Boyles is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Equinees A Boyles was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Boyles  to  5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any prior sentences
Consecutive to: any prior sentences

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fees in the amount of $175

--not to possess or consume illegal drugs or alcohol

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent

--random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Fort Atkinson PD
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent

[MA]Case called at 2:25pm 
Defendant Equinees A Boyles in court, in custody with Attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen and Attorney Susan Alesia.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Grotelueschen will prepare an order for the Court's signature.

The Court is in receipt of Defendant's Postconviction Motion for Plea Withdrawal and Suppression of Evidence and it appears an evidentiary hearing is required. 

The Court sets a briefing schedule as follows: State to file brief or non objection letter by 6/4/18; Defense to file response by 6/15/18; Court will determine whether or not to schedule an evidentiary hearing by 6/22/18.

[MA]Case called at 11:06am
Defendant Equinees A Boyles in court, in custody with attorney John Paul Marchan.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Boyles

The Court sentences Mr. Boyles  to  5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any prior sentences. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--not to possess or consume illegal drugs or alcohol
--no contanct with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fees in the amount of $175


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 11:36am

Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] case called at 3:51pm. 
Defendant Equinees A Boyles in court, in custody,with Attorney David Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Final Status Scheduling Conference today and for Jury Trial next week. 
The Court rules on the Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements:  the Court concludes that this involved a legal Terry investigative stop; the officer did have reasonable suspicion for the stop; because Miranda is not required, there was no violation of Miranda, and the statements are admissible for trial.    
Thereafter Attorney Zarwell submits paperwork for entry of a change-in-plea.

The Court reviews the plea paperwork with Mr. Boyles, verifying with Mr. Boyles that he understands that the plea agreement is that upon of entry of a plea to Count #1, the State will move for outright dismissal of Count #2;  however there is no agreement as to sentence-recommendaionts 
On Motion of the State, the Court amends the Complaint to correct the subject controlled substance amount to .54 grams. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated including as to prior conviction status; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses Count #2 outright. 
The Court revokes Bond. The Defendant is to be held in custody until the Sentencing Hearing. 
recess 4:11pm.  

NEXT:  Sentencing Hearing on 10/27/16 at 2:30pm.

Case called at 1:54pm [MA] 
Defendant Equinees A Boyles in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Defendant's Motion to Suppress:

Officer Hefty sworn and testifies
--direct examination by DA Happ
--Exhibit #1 (squad video of traffic stop)-- played 3:57:20-- 4:12
--Counsel agree Reporter does not need to take down audio of video

--Exhibit #2(video from booking room at Fort Atkinson PD) 

--cross examination by Atty. Zarwell
--playing of Exhibit #1
recess: 3:00pm--reconvene: 3:05pm

--continued cross examination by Atty. Zarwell
--playing of Exhibit #2
--Defendant's Exhibit #3(probable cause statement)

--questioning by the Court
--redirect by DA Happ
--recross by Atty. Zarwell

Evidence Closed at: 3:35pm

Arguments given by Counsel
The Court finds that the Officer had legal purpose to stop the vehicle and probable cause of 4 traffic violations.

As to State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements and Defenses Written Objection:
--Arguments given by Counsel


The Court directs Counsel to write briefs, whether Miranda is required in a temporary investigation under Terry re: the questions after the Defendant says "cocaine" at the traffic stop; to be submitted by 9/6/16 at 8:00am

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

As to the State's Other Acts Motion:
--arguments given by Counsel
--the Court determines that the 4 prior bad acts offered by the State are valid
--the Court finds that the 4 cases are relevant and probative; gives basis
--the Court finds that the 4 prior acts are admissible
--the Court finds that the 4 acts are not admissible for identifying the Defendant

recess: 4:35pm--reconvene: 4:37pm

As to admissibility of text messages:
--arguments given by Counsel 

DA Happ provides the Court and Atty. Zarwell with page 5 of text messages to indicate time stamp.
text messages gernerated by Defendant and recieved are admissibile
text messages generated by others are not admissible fo truth purposes 

recess: 5:00pm 

NEXT: FSSC  and Jury Trial to remain as scheduled
